We have been scammed by this restaurant. We had booked seats for 35 people through Tau Saigon's website, 350 000 VND per person include free tea. On Saturday night (February 23rd), we went on the boat, waited for 30 MINUTES for the tea even though we have asked them to bring tea out many times. Not only the tea, but also the food was arrived super late. The food was bad, dry and poor. Waiters/waitresses' attitudes were unacceptable and the smile never appeared on their faces. We wasted 11 million VND for bad food, bad attitudes, is this worthy? We left with anger and hunger. It is sure that we will not return to Tau Saigon anymore. After returning home, we called the receptionist who we booked at, they said that they would phone us later, however, we received no answer since then. Can not believe that there is this kind of business exist in the city's tourism. We advise you not to book any seat at Tau Saigon, or you will waste your money.

I came here around 1130am on a Tuesday and barely anyone was even there, which made my visit to this Buddist temple that much better as I love being able to see monumental establishments in peace. Though the actual temple has been closed for lunch and was not reopeninh until 2pm. So my cousin Cam and I decided to have lunch at their on site cafe. All dishes were vegetarian of course and reasonably priced at 20000 vnd per dish. I got the rice plate, while my cousin got their noodle soup. Not exactly sure what I was eating, haha, but all the flavors were amazing! I also enjoyed their soybean milk (10000 vnd) so much, I wanted to buy 2 more to take home, but they were already sold out with only one left, so of course I got what they had left! üòÉ

Nguyen Hue is a pretty nice walk way amongst all the crazy traffic in HCMC central! Best to visit in the evening when it is cooler, and when there is street food available - there are also some street performances - last night there was a group of kids break dancing! There are loads of food and cafe either side of the street - we visited Buihaus for coffee and cake at level 7, 42 nguyen hue - highly recommended! A significant negative - we tried to cross the street on the side when it was pedestrian green light - cars and bikes still drove through - absolutely ridiculous - it defeats the purpose of having pedestrian lights in the first place! The police must do more and fine these ignorant drivers!

Located in my thi luu just off the main road in da kao, emperor jade pagoda is truly a devine and peaceful location. It is a world away from the hustling and bustling of HCMC, the architecure is very nice and meaningful, it is just a wonderful place to visit to say a little prayer. There is a fish pond and a pond full of turtles on the outside - bound to keep the kids entertained to a certain degree although this temple is no place for kids. Inside the temple there is the main component, the sides and upstairs (the stairs are very narrow somewhat like batu caves in kuala lumpur). Overall, an experience worth visiting and spending some time at.

user_titlec: Best of the bests in Saigon!
user_comment: Where to start... I‚Äôm been there regular customer since January 2017, it is a review long over due! I felt in love with The Reverie when i was staying at Le Meridien Saigon. I noticed that flashing neon building everytime i passed by at night and asked my friend about it. He told me its a newly open hotel and i should check it out. I‚Äôm glad i did! 3 years later and counting, its my luxurious hide away right in the heart of a bustling saigon‚Äôs city life. The Reverie is a truly 5 stars hotel, from the building itself, to location, food, accomodation, and services, not many hotel can matched. I think i had uploaded plenty of pictures of my many stays with them, so i let its speak for itself. I tried all the restaurants and cafe from Reverie, except RJ‚Äôs, that is on my next to try list. Little interesting unknown facts: The Reverie‚Äôs has a helicopter pad! And its the ONLY building in the city to had permit for helicopter to land, NOT even Bitexco! If you are a keen book reader this little street is a great place for you to stroll! There are a myriad of book shops, mixture of english and vietnamese books. There were also displays which were quite interesting - we saw the display showing female journalists from the early 1900's until the end of the viet nam war - it was rather interesting! There are a few cafes for coffee and a light snack, and a 24 / 7 mcdonalds for all your burger and fries craving! Best thing is that no scooters allowed so you can walk feeling safe!

user_titlec: Lots of clothes very nice & cheap
user_comment: Noon the other day, I went to the market to buy things. Walk around for a while, for sightseeing stalls, then I finally stopped 1 stall. This stall sells some clothes that I'm quite satisfied with üòç, the owner doesn't look too aggressive like another stalls. I look at the owners of another stalls looking very fierceüò∞. But rest assured, there is always a guard teamüëÆ inside a market, so it's rare for a fight to happen üòá. I bought 3 shirts: The Starbuck & HardRock, I bargain with owner for a while, then reduced to: ‚úîÔ∏è80k / 1 shirt (Initially shouted 150k / 1 shirt‚ùå), Gucci: ‚úîÔ∏è150k / 1 shirt (Initially shouted 250k‚ùå). Because buying clothes in market can't as expensive as the shop + need to watch the fabric carefully (very thin fabric) + owner alway says this fabric is cool to wear (they just cheating youüëé). It is recommended for you: üëâ You can deal with owner reduce 40% a price of a product , when I ready to leave, owner called me back immediately (because there are lots of stall in the market sell this shirts, easy to find another stall sell üòó üòè). ‚ö†Ô∏è These are mainly to cheat tourist, foreigner, but not easy with local üòÑ In addition, in the market there is selling food, wallet, backpack, other things are also cheap, if you know how to bid üòè. If you don't bid, you'll buy 100% expensive üëç.

The most well known market amongst tourists and locals, Ben Thanh market has the lot under its roof. Of course there are many shops for tourusts (ie me), which are all overpriced until you start to hard bargain with then - i generally start with 50 % off their asking price and go further down from there - if they do not budge i just move to the next shop! There are plenty of food and drinks there which are actually well priced for its location and also of good quality compared to what is around the market! I would suggest an early start (opens at 6am) to beat the tourist rush and the hot metal roof!

My American friends and teachers had the chance to stay here for the second time in a row since last year they also stayed here. That's might explained how awesome this hotel is right? They said they really enjoy it there. I have the chance to visit it 3 times while they stayed there. Love the experience though! The hotel located on CMT8 street, next to Ph·∫°m ƒê√¨nh To√°i alley, quite easy to notice cause it's so high and whiteüè©The outside offer chairs, tables and a big spot for parking but normally our bus just parks right before the hotel, one the street waiting for us in a short time period though. The lobby is on the right of ground floor, the left side is a small diner place offer Western buffet for meals. Right the entrace are two quit small elevators and emergency stairs. There are 12 floors at the hotel. The 12th and ground floor offer meals by both buffet and a la carte in VNese food and also in Western one. I got the chance to eat at ground floor for breakfast the day we got to be ready for our gala. My breakfast always that biggg though :)) I took everything a little bit to try them all. I love the deep fried fish to the moon and backkk! The rest was just so so, nothing to mention then. The 12th floor restaurant is bigger and have a nice view to the city. Both of the restaurants are decorated in a fancy way with white marble üòç The rooms are a little bit to the small side however it is very much convenient and adorable. There are two beds per room, a bathroom, a closet, a small fridge, an AC, a makeup table, a chair and everything you need for an afternoon tea or whenever you are craving. There are three photos from the room windows and a selfie of mine cause the lighting is on fleek üòÜ The decoration is also legit guys! We lovvve the plant background so much! It is a great spot for taking photos üòéAnd we have a bunch of unforgetful memories there ‚ô•Ô∏è Hope they gonna come back next yearrr then üòã

user_titlec: Clean and safe, beautiful apartment and great pool. Perfect Staff.
user_comment: My boss and I usually stay at Sunny almost every month for our business management. Our room is always clean, well equipped with microwave, kettle, cookers, hair dryer, electric water heater and so on. Great water pressure and hot water in the shower. Full size fridge. Comfortable bed. The swimming pool and gym there is also perfect. The infinity pool on rooftop floor where you can enjoy the stunning view and city's skyline. It's really fantastic to relax after work. It's centrally located very near our office, district 4 and also district 1 for entertainment. Sunny 's staff was so kind, genuine, friendly, hospitable and went out of their way to make sure our stay was a fantastic one. She gave us all these useful local tips about food places and places to see that we would otherwise never have known - we can‚Äôt thank them enough. After work we usually enjoy the city followed their guide before. If you want to fully discover the city feel free to ask them. We love our room, their lovely apartment. Highly recommend Sunny to others. See you next month, Sunny.

Clearly recommendable. Everything, from coming in at the door, to the staff. That was perfect. The place is extremely cozy and placed in very beautiful surroundings. The whole place, the rooms, the restaurants and the outside areas were very clean. The atmosphere was very calm and made you feel very relaxed. The swimming pool and gym 's so good. There was a very high level of service, and the staff was very attentive to you, which made you feel really welcome. I and my family had a trip to Saigon last month. We booked a three bedroom apartment at Sunny. We arrived at their property at midnight. We were all so tired. Sunny's staff came early and waited for us. It just took 5 minutes to check in and enter the room very smoothly. Our room is on the twenty eighth floor of The Tresor which overlooks over the city and river. It was really a fantastic place for us. The beds are in royal style and very large. Everything there might be so new and makes us feel like we are the first guests of this house. The apartment was fully furnished with many modern household appliances. Do yourself a favor, go on a stay and enjoy it

user_titlec: Very comfy apartment! Excellent location! And a fabulous pool!
user_comment: We had a perfect stay at Sunny Tropical 2. Bedroom suite was spacious and beautiful. Room was also quiet but we could hear the wonderful sound of the rushing river outside. I was amazed at the outdoor pool and the modern gym there. It was a delightful experience with a fabulous view of the pool as soon as you open the door. It was wonderful to swim and relax after walking around sightseeing. Very genuine helpful staff from check in to check out. We heard they reminded their guests with many tips to enjoy Saigon perfectly whenever they checked in. Very neat and delicate room. Oh their housekeeping staff worked well during our stay. They are very sociable and always give you more than enough towels and toiletries. Our stay was so smooth and memorable. Thank you, Sunny. I‚Äôd highly recommend your service.

I and my family stayed at Sunny's property last November. Everything is perfect from check in to check out. During our stay there, the staff was very helpful and gracious. They took care us well and replied our request immediately. In terms of rooms, there was nothing to make us unpleasant. The private room was nice and clean. Living room was so spacious and bright. Their maid worked well and room cleaning perfectly. They made our trip perfect too! The rooftop infinity pool and kid's pool were fantastic. So modern and nice. Location is also great. Just a short walking distance to the city center, district 1 to eat and shop. Taxi and security staff works 24 hours. Sunny's property is located in a very good place. It was super quiet at night. We highly recommend Sunny to other guests if you would like to take your holiday in Saigon. We definitely come back next year. Thank you, Sunny

user_titlec: Awesome Apartment with the convenient location! Close to district and very peaceful for us to take a rest!
user_comment: My family stay at Sunny Tropical was absolutely fantastic!! We stayed at this property for 4 nights last month. The hotel has the perfect location, very near my favorite places in Vietnam like Bui Vien Street, Nguyen Hue Walking Street and Ben Thanh Market. Away from the mad Saigon rush yet close to all the major shopping and party places, restaurants and bar that Saigon has on offer. The room was so nice and fully furnished. Hairdryer, an iron and washing machine are a part of the room's standard amenities, all of which come really handy and help save up on those extra expenses incurred on laundry. We really loved the swimming pool there. So pure and beautiful! The staff was very helpful and courteous. My family said that she was very impressed by the conscientious staff there. Next year, we will come to Saigon again and we also stay there.

user_titlec: Fantastic Apartment with reasonable price and helpful staff!
user_comment: We arrived in Saigon at 23.00 and my friends recommended us booking online on Booking.com at Sunny Tropical Serviced Apartments for our family 4 people and our kids. We got the two-bedroom one with the caring support from the staff there. The room was so good with fully furnished. It has a pool on the roof top which is extremely pure and beautiful. During the time waiting for my friend return, we had a wonderful time there. We also had chance to travel around Saigon and enjoy Vietnamese cuisine thanks to the food maps provided by the staffs and they were willing to help us get to the address on foot if could. We found staff very professional and conscientious. Overall experience is great and I recommend the Serviced Apartments to all of you who want to kick start a holiday.

user_titlec: THE BESTSERVICED APARTMENT WE HAVE EVER VISITED IN HCMC
user_comment: We travel a lot and we have visited many hotels and serviced apartments around the world. This is one of the best places we have ever visited. Sunny has rooms in several buildings. We got a completely new three bedroom apartment in The Tresor building, unit 23.03. The room was super large sized, had free wifi, a coffee packets, free mineral water during my stay.The room was all new and beautifully decorated in a royal style. There was a nice, comfortable sofa and dining table. The beds were amazing like specially designed for kings. The cable television had many channels to relax. The bathroom was large, clean and new. Very nice decor. The pool at the 2nd floor is good and comfortable. The gym and personal trainers there are perfect. You need try it when staying there. The hotel staff are amazing, so friendly and polite. We strongly recommend a visit here if you want a relaxing stay with super quality rooms, food and staff.

Spending 30 days traveling so staying in different hotels is a must for my whole trip. I was lucky enough to travel and experience Vietnam from South to North. Though I stayed in many hotels from Hue, Da Nang, Hoi an, Thailand and 3 different hotels in Saigon, this is one of my favorite hotel because it made me feel like home!!!! First, the location is perfect. If you are a traveler who barely knows where to eat or to shop, this is the place to stay. It is close to the Saigon center where you can easy to grab a cab to any well-known places like: Ben Thanh market, Ho Con Rua, Diamond plaza, Vincom ect. within 5-10 minutes. Especially, it is only 3 minutes walking from the hotel to Bui Vien street which is so called ‚Äúbackpackers‚Äù district where all the night action is. Everything is walkable. Second, one of the PLUS of this hotel is the hospitality of the Staffs. They are so friendly and make you feel like home. I stayed in many hotels in Vietnam, one of the most common thing when I walked in the hotel with my friends who just wanted to visit me, the front desk would stop me and asked so many unnecessary questions that if my friend would spend the night there or not, it really bugged and made me uncomfortable. I had no such an experience like that when staying in this hotel. The receptionist is always available to help you with a smile and ask appropriate questions. I usually hangout late till 2-3am (it was Euro 2016 soccer) and I got no problem going in and out because there is always a guy there to open the door for you 24/7. In addition, it is complete free to have your motorcycle parked and watched during your stay as well. So another big bonus for this hotel. Third, since the hotel just opened in June 2016 so the everything is new, clean, upscale and definitely no complaints about its facilities. Overall, staying in many different hotels, this is the place that makes me most comfortable. The price is reasonable for its location and services. I got 50% discount since it is grand opening. Also, the hotel‚Äôs owner is really nice. He got a restaurant nearby that serves Dim sum and Singapore porridge. If you are his customer, enjoy 10% discount for the restaurant bill every time you eat. I would definitely come back !! Additional info: -Free wifi, free parking -3 room types: Single, double and family
